meanings.definition: A model or example for imitation or comparison.
meanings.sent1: In art class, the teacher showed us different ensamples of paintings to learn from.
meanings.sent2: The ensamples of good behavior set by the older students were admired by the younger ones.
meanings.sent3: The ensamples of how not to behave in public were quite entertaining to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness towards strangers was an ensample of how to brighten someone's day.
meanings.sent5: The ensample of perseverance shown by the marathon runner inspired others to never give up.

meanings.sent1: The scientist studied many ensamples of the rare mineral to understand its properties.
meanings.sent2: The ensamples of wildlife in the national park were diverse and fascinating.
meanings.sent3: Finding a unicorn in the forest would be a truly magical ensample of luck.
meanings.sent4: The ensample of a blooming flower symbolized growth and renewal.
meanings.sent5: The ensample of a loyal dog waiting for its owner touched the hearts of passersby.
